FuncDef:
The save all virtual-systems command saves configurations of all virtual systems to the file to be loaded at the next startup.
If a virtual system does not have a next startup file, the default configuration file is used as the file to be loaded at the next startup.
Examples: Warning: The current configuration for all the virtual systems will be written to the device. Continue? [Y/N]:y
Now saving the current configuration to the slot 1.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To save configurations of virtual systems to the file to be loaded at the next startup, run the save all virtual-systems command.
Prerequisites
The disk has sufficient space for storing configuration files.
Implementation Procedure
Run the save all virtual-systems command. Configuration files will be generated at the system configuration file directory.
Configuration Impact
Configuration files will be generated on the disk.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
